notes.text:
Red Hat Ansible Tower 3.7.5-1 - RHEL7 Container

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of
Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Security Fix(es):

* Addressed a security issue which can allow a malicious playbook author to elevate to the awx user from outside the isolated environment: CVE-2021-20253
* Upgraded to a more recent version of autobahn to address CVE-2020-35678.
* Upgraded to a more recent version of nginx to address CVE-2019-20372.

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* Fixed a bug which can intermittently cause access to encrypted Tower settings to fail, resulting in failed job launches.
* Improved analytics collection to collect the playbook status for all hosts in a playbook run
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Ansible Tower 3.7.5-1 - Container security and bug fix update

cwe.name: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling')

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: NGINX before 1.17.7, with certain error_page configurations, allows HTTP request smuggling, as demonstrated by the ability of an attacker to read unauthorized web pages in environments where NGINX is being fronted by a load balancer.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nginx: HTTP request smuggling in configurations with URL redirect used as error_page
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1790277: CVE-2019-20372 nginx: HTTP request smuggling in configurations with URL redirect used as error_page

remediations.details: For information on upgrading Ansible Tower, reference the Ansible Tower Upgrade and Migration Guide: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-tower/latest/html/upgrade-migration-guide/index.html

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-20372 nginx: HTTP request smuggling in configurations with URL redirect used as error_page

cwe.name: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in python-autobahn, where it allows redirect header injection. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality and integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

references.summary: bz#1911314: CVE-2020-35678 python-autobahn: allows redirect header injection

cwe.name: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: A flaw was found in ansible-tower. The default installation is vulnerable to Job Isolation escape allowing an attacker to elevate the privilege from a low privileged user to the awx user from outside the isolated environment. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ansible-tower: Privilege escalation via job isolation escape
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1928847: CVE-2021-20253 ansible-tower: Privilege escalation via job isolation escape
